There‚Äôs no place like home, and certainly no place like a club that feels like home!

Our vision and values.

Film Garden aims to

Inspire Discovery

Introduce members to a wide range of films, from mainstream hits to independent and international cinema.

Encourage Dialogue

Create a safe, engaging space for thoughtful discussions and respectful debates about the films we watch.¬†

Build Community

Facilitate meaningful connections between students, helping them find their "circle" outside of academic life

Support Creativity

Provide a platform for students, especially those in Interaction Design and related fields, to explore visual storytelling and creative critique.¬†

‚ÄúBeing firends is even better than honey. I know.‚Äù

-Winnie the Pooh of course

Club Rules and Policy¬†

1. Respectful Discussion is Paramount¬†

2. Confidentiality¬†

We encourage open sharing of thoughts and feelings about films, but members must respect the privacy of their peers. Do not share personal details discussed within the club outside of our meetings without explicit permission.¬†

3. Punctuality and Commitment¬†

We value your time and the time of others. Please try to arrive promptly for scheduled screenings and discussions. If you commit to a club role or task, please follow through responsibly.¬†

4. Content Awareness Policy¬†

Some films may contain challenging or mature content. While we strive to provide a diverse selection, we will always aim to give a content warning before viewing potentially sensitive material. If you are uncomfortable with a film selection, you are always welcome to opt-out of viewing it‚Äîyour presence and participation in the discussion are what matter most.¬†

5. Keep Our Garden Tidy¬†

Please ensure you clean up your personal area before leaving the meeting space. This includes disposing of all trash (popcorn bags, drink containers, wrappers, etc.) in the designated bins. Keeping our shared space clean helps us maintain a comfortable environment for everyone.¬†

6. Sheridan College Code of Conduct¬†

All Film Garden activities and members must comply fully with the Sheridan College Student Code of Conduct and all campus policies.¬†

Meet the Film Garden Committee

Anya Sharma, 4 year interaction Design: President

As the club's President, Anya oversees all club operations, leads executive meetings, and acts as the primary liaison with the Sheridan Student Union. She founded Film Garden to bridge the creative gap between different programs and build community. Anya‚Äôs Pick: "I love films that blend stunning visuals with deep emotion, like the works of Denis Villeneuve or Park Chan-wook. My absolute favourite film, which we screened last semester, is Portrait of a Lady on Fire. It‚Äôs a masterclass in direction and cinematography."

Liam Chen, 3rd year Film and Television: Program Coordinator¬†

Liam is the creative force behind our weekly schedule. He is responsible for curating the diverse film selections, organizing special-themed movie nights, and securing the best viewing locations on campus. Liam‚Äôs pick: "I'm a massive fan of classic cinema and obscure documentaries. You‚Äôll usually find me advocating for a deep-dive into German Expressionism or early Tarantino. My current obsession is the entire body of work by Studio Ghibli, especially Spirited Away."

Sarah Lee, 2nd year, business marketing: Communications Officer¬†

Sarah manages all our outward-facing content, including the website updates, social media posts, and the weekly meeting reminders. She ensures every member knows what we‚Äôre watching and where we‚Äôre meeting. Sarah‚Äôs pick: "I'm always watching something new, but I have a huge soft spot for sharp, witty screenplays, especially in the comedy and mystery genres. For me, nothing beats the perfectly plotted twists and ensemble cast of Rian Johnson's Knives Out."

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: How do I join Film Garden?¬†

A: It's easy! Simply attend one of our scheduled meetings or screenings (check the News page for details). Our club executives will be there to welcome you and provide a quick sign-up form. There are no fees to join!

Q: Do I have to be in Interaction Design to join?

A: Absolutely not! While we have a strong presence among Interaction Design students, Film Garden is open to all Sheridan College students who share a passion for film, regardless of their program of study.

Q: I‚Äôm new to film/I haven't seen many classics. Will I feel out of place?

A: Not at all! We welcome everyone from casual viewers to seasoned cinephiles. Our vision is about discovery. We encourage open discussion and respect all levels of film knowledge.

Q: How often does the club meet?¬†

A: We typically hold one main screening and discussion session per week, plus occasional extra social events or themed movie nights. The exact schedule is always posted on the News page.

Contact Us

Have a question about joining, suggesting a film, or our next meeting? We'd love to hear from you!¬†
